skillTree.localised_description: A general's horse can be their most trusted and daring companion. Just don't name him 'Daisy'.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

skillTree.localised_description: An Imperial pegasus is a noble, winged steed, intelligent and loyal.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Once trained to carry a man in battle, Imperial griffons are poised killers and incredibly dedicated to their riders.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: It is important to protect the trade routes within Drakwald forest, for without trade, there is no Hochland.

effects.description:
Attribute: Immune to Psychology for Halberdiers units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

effects.description:
Bonus vs. Large: +14 for Halberdiers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: In Hochland, they say, a man may love his Longrifle more than his wife.

effects.description:
Attribute: Stalk for Handgunner units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

effects.description:
Missile damage: +20% for Handgunner units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Aldebrand Ludenhof is a consummate politician and experienced hunter, strong of body and mind. Each of these skills lends to a rather unique style of warfare.

effects.description:
All infantry units in Aldebrand Ludenhof's army receive Vanguard Deployment
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: At times, Aldebrand will bring a great horned owl to battle. In Hochland, the owl represents both wisdom and death. Though not a ferocious beast, the perching owl is symbolic of his master's efficiency - both in matters of governing and in matters of war.

Ludenhof's hunting hawk, Parzifal, is his master's most favored bird. Trained, as all of his birds, from a hatchling, Parzifal lends aid to his master by viciously attacking the Count's enemy whilst in combat.

effects.description:
Enemy melee defence: -5
	(Enemy lords in local region)
Parzifal, Ludenhof's warhawk scouts the nearby regions, revealing them to your faction on your turn.

skillTree.localised_description: This large predator takes to the sky at the start of a battle. Ludenhof has but to whistle and point, and the eagle will dive sharply to attack his unwitting, and unlucky, foe with large razor-sharp talons.

ui_effects.localised_text: Spawned unit fights in this battle only
Spawned unit fights in this battle only

effects.description: Army ability number of uses: +1 for "Raptor Lord: Eagle"

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”

skillTree.localised_description: These steeds are bred for speed and war, but foremost it is their gallop which marks them out.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord expects his men to practice the disciplines of the Pistolkorps, and all be expert marksmen.

skillTree.localised_description: Honest Empire-forged steel is all a state trooper could ask when confronting the myriad foes in battle.

skillTree.localised_description: The frontline will either make or break you. Those who survive become the backbone of any army.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -35% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.

As an elected governing official of the Empire, an Elector Count has the power and authority to raise troops from his home province. In times of need, or if a regiment is being raised by the right individual, the Count may grant his favor to a unit.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

factionEffects.localised_description: A rather unimposing figure, the Elector Count of Hochland is not a man one would expect to see on the battlefield. His lanky frame only serves to further this notion. However, Aldebrand Ludenhof is a consummate politician and experienced hunter, strong of body and mind. Each of these skills lends to a rather unique style of warfare.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% during forest battles
	(all characters)
Unit experience gain: +25% during forest battles

ui_effects.localised_text: Spawned unit fights in this battle only

items.colour_text: The Elector Counts always have a regiment of Greatswords with them at all times, for they act both as a bodyguard regiment and as a reserve force of elite warriors that has the potential to turn the tide of many battles.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Although Hochland is not an especially large or important province its count is one of the most valiant leaders in the Empire. Aldebrand is very tall and thin, but immensely strong and fit, making him a match for larger, heavier opponents in combat.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +8 during forest battles
	(Lord's army)
